title: Liverpool news: Steven Gerrard hails 'relentless' Luis Suarez | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 8:15 pm Steven Gerrard says Liverpool could have won the league had Luis Suarez stayed (Picture: Getty) 
Former Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard has hailed Barcelona forward Luis Suarez as ‘relentless’ and said the striker was a dream to play alongside. 
The pair spent three years together at Anfield before Suarez’s £75million move to the Camp Nou in 2014. 
Suarez has taken his game to the next level under Luis Enrique and won the Champions League in his debut season in Spain. 
The Uruguayan was selected to start in Barcelona’s last-16 clash with PSG on Tuesday night and Gerrard said Liverpool could have won the league if Suarez stayed on Merseyside. Suarez joined Barcelona in 2014 (Picture: Getty) 
‘There’s so many good teams in the PL but he would have given Liverpool a better chance,’ Gerrard told Bt. 
‘You’re guaranteed goals, assists, he just causes every opposition problems and creates a lot of space for the players around him. 
‘He’s relentless – that’s the word to sum him up. He scores great goals, all type of goals, he creates out of nothing. 
‘He occupies the whole back four by himself. He was an absolute dream to play with. He was always on the move so that you could pick him out. Just a phenomenal footballer. He’s gone to another level since he moved to Barcelona with his goal and assist return.’
